result.execSummary:
The defendant Tevin J Peale was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
STAYED.
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration.

miscConds.notes:
Court Costs to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
No alcohol or drugs.
No contact with the victim or her family, directly, indirectly or through a 3rd party.
Register as a Sex Offender.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by his Agent, including Sex Offender treatment.
Provide DNA sample if not yet provided.

timeConds.notes:
Condition Time - (nonworking hours) Once defendant reaches the 120 day mark, he may have Huber Privileges. Standard release conditions.
COMMENCE FORTHWITH.

AS OF 9/10/14: 105 days was for CONDITION TIME, NOT the STAYED PRISON SENTENCE.

records.addlTxt: Pretrial Incarceration Credit form filed by Defense.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Tevin J Peale in court, in custody, with attorney Douglas M. Bihler.   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Amended Information filed - reading waived.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty. Deborah H. made statements. 

Court orders the following:
Ct. 1: 
- Total sentence: 6 years (Initial Confinement: 3 years, Extended Supervision: 3 years)  Stayed for 5 years Probation
- Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration 
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Substance Abuse Program. 
- Court Costs of $268.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation; alternate 6 days jail - consecutive
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation; alternate 5 days jail - consecutive
- Conditions of  Probation: Maintain absolute sobriety - no alcohol/drugs. No contact with the victim or her family, directly, indirectly or through a 3rd party. Register as a sex offender.   Submit to an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.  Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended including sex offender treatment.  DNA Sample if not yet provided.
 - 9 months jail Condition Time - 105 days credit, once defendant reaches the 120 day mark he may have huber privileges (nonworking hours) commencing FORTHWITH. Standard Release Conditions.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 5, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Tevin J Peale in court, in custody, with attorney Douglas M. Bihler.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense requests to withdraw the motion to suppress and requests a plea/sentencing date.  Court grants both requests.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 5, 2014 at 10:30 am.
From defendant requesting the Court reconsider his bail.

Defendant to have no contact with victim listed in the Criminal Complaint or with her residence or her family. No unsupervised contact with any female under the age of 18 and no use of any device that has internet access.
